```{webr}

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
```

## Q2 — Z Confidence Interval (Lower Bound) {#q2}
Using `Exam_Score`, assume σ=12.

Construct a 95% Z confidence interval for the true mean exam score.

What is the lower bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- ___
n <- ___
sigma <- ___
z <- ___

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- mean(x)
n <- length(x)
sigma <- 12
z <- qnorm(0.975)
xbar - z*sigma/sqrt(n)
# 77.3330
```
## Q3 — Z Confidence Interval (Upper Bound) {#q3}
Using `Exam_Score`, assume σ=12.

Construct a 95% Z confidence interval for the true mean exam score.

What is the upper bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- ___
n <- ___
sigma <- ___
z <- ___

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- mean(x)
n <- length(x)
sigma <- 12
z <- qnorm(0.975)
xbar + z*sigma/sqrt(n)
# 82.5921
```
## Q4 — t Critical Value {#q4}
Using `Final_Exam_Score`:

What is the 95% two-sided t* critical value?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
n <- length(df$Final_Exam_Score)

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
n <- length(df$Final_Exam_Score)
qt(0.975, df = n - 1)
#1.9904
```
## Q5 — t Confidence Interval (Lower Bound) {#q5}
Construct a 95% t confidence interval for the true mean `Final_Exam_Score`.

What is the lower bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Final_Exam_Score
xbar <- ___
s <- ___
n <- ___
tstar <- ___
```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Final_Exam_Score
xbar <- mean(x)
s <- sd(x)
n <- length(x)
tstar <- qt(0.975, df = n - 1)
xbar - tstar*s/sqrt(n)
#78.1086
```

## Q6 — t Confidence Interval (Upper Bound) {#q6}
Construct a 95% t confidence interval for the true mean `Final_Exam_Score`.


## Q7 — Proportion CI (Lower Bound){#q7}
Construct a 95% Z confidence interval for the true admission proportion.

What is the lower bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Admitted
n <- ___
phat <- ___
z <- ___

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Admitted
n <- length(x)
phat <- mean(x)
z <- qnorm(0.975)
phat - z*sqrt(phat*(1-phat)/n)
#0.5996
```

## Q8 — Proportion CI (Upper Bound){#q8}

